title: 109_s3584
content: The "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006" requires mandatory training programs for supervisors. The "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006" mandates training programs for supervisors, defining the term 'supervisor' broadly and outlining requirements for interactive instructor-based programs. The "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006" mandates interactive instructor-based training programs for supervisors on various actions, options, and strategies to improve employee performance and productivity. The "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006" requires supervisors to mentor and motivate employees, manage unacceptable performance, and carry out supervisory duties. Additionally, it mandates training on prohibited personnel practices and enforcement procedures, as well as a mentorship program for new supervisors. The "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006" mandates programs for supervisors to mentor new supervisors and complete training on various skills like communication, critical thinking, and motivating employees within a year of appointment. The "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006" requires supervisors to complete training programs within a year of appointment and undergo additional training every three years. The Office of Personnel Management will establish programs and regulations to ensure compliance with the Act. The Office of Personnel Management will prescribe regulations for supervisor training, with an effective date 180 days after enactment of the Act. The amendments made by this section will take effect 180 days after the enactment of the Act. They apply to individuals appointed as supervisors and those employed in supervisor positions on the effective date. Individuals in supervisor positions on the effective date must complete training programs established under section 4121(b)(2) of title 5, United States Code. Supervisors employed on the effective date must complete training programs under section 4121(b)(2) of title 5, United States Code within 3 years and every 3 years thereafter. SEC. 3. MANAGEMENT COMPETENCY STANDARDS. Chapter 43 of title 5, United States Code, is amended to include new management competency standards for supervisors. The Office of Personnel Management will provide guidance to agencies on these standards, and each agency must develop performance assessment standards for supervisors. The Office of Personnel Management will issue guidance to agencies on standards for supervisors to effectively manage employee performance. Each agency must develop performance assessment standards for supervisors, assess their capacity to meet the guidance, and implement a training program to address identified issues. Each agency must develop performance assessment standards for supervisors, assess their capacity to meet the guidance, and implement a training program to address identified issues. Agencies are required to submit an annual report on their progress in implementing these requirements. Technical and conforming amendments are made to the table of sections for chapter 43 of title 5, United States Code. The text discusses the amendment of management competency standards in section 4304(b)(3) of title 5, United States Code, by replacing "section 4305" with "section 4306."
